name: Pottery House Loch Ness B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful setting for a wonderful B&B. Highly recommended... lovely room and very good breakfast.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't forget to try the Dores Inn...the food there is wonderful and you get lots of it! :o)
reviews.title: Just excellent... I wish all B&B were like this one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is a charming place in a perfect location, you can almost touch Nessy... excellent room with lots of details, great bathroom and a perfect example of an Scottish breakfast, served like an elegant hotel. The service was great too and they were really helpful, thanks to John & Glen we discovered "the Fall of Foyers" near Loch Ness.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pottery house is a very friendly and welcoming BnB in the perfect location. The view from our room was straight through the trees and onto the loch. One of the best views to wake up to.
reviews.title: Excellent bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were particularly impressed by the Enviromentally friendly ethos throughout the entirity of the house, it's unsuprising that they have won so many awards.
reviews.title: All you want in a B and B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely large room with good en-suite. Tasty breakfast with plenty of choice and homemade bread and jams. Set in peaceful village on the banks of Loch Ness only 10-15 minutes from Inverness.
reviews.title: Cosy, comfy B&B.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend the Dores Inn for evening meal. We stayed 2 nights and dined there both nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location for places of interest in the surrounding area. Would stay again.
reviews.title: a standard all B&Bs should aspire to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room very comfortable, spotlessly clean, towels, shampoo, shower Gel all provided, you wanted for nothing.
reviews.title: Best B&Bwe have stayed in 5 star everything was excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast to die for, plus home made bread rolls and jam.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent attention to detail.
reviews.title: A very comfortable, relaxing stay with beautiful views of Loch Ness.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good information pack.
reviews.title: Attention to detail makes pottery house excell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some lovely finishing touches (ie. homemade jam. fresh eggs, jug of milk and iced water in fridge, make your own muesli!)
reviews.title: Pure Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not sure about logging on to choose your bread roll!
reviews.title: Absolute gem in the Scottish Highlands!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very nice breakfast - not greasy, beautiful presented and perfect portion size.
reviews.title: Pottery House could not have been better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: We have just returned from a tour of Scotland staying here at Pottery House for 2 nights with my parents. We found the rooms stunning, the breakfast delightful and the hosts very welcoming. The only downside for my parents (being in their mid-70s) was walking up to the B&B as it was rather steep.
reviews.title: Lovely welcoming B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the B&B is great though for us, and the hill did not hinder us or our stay in any way.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hospitality, Exquisite View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B exceeded our expectations in all areas. We had a room directly overlooking Loch Ness, which is a minute's walk away. The landlord was pleasant and helpful without being intrusive. The room was extremely spacious, warm and meticulously clean. All furnishing is new. Our sleep was unperturbed, this little village is a lovely place. We definitely would like to go back to spend a whole long weekend there. We slept at 3 B&Bs during our trip up to Scotland and the Pottery house was by far the best!
reviews.title: Quiet, clean, friendly and unobstrusive. Excellent breakfasts too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were very impressed with the size and cleanliness of our room and the excellent breakfasts that were cooked to order. We are vegetarian and were well satisfied with the menu.
reviews.title: Extraordinary B&B experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can tell that John and Glen have made every effort to make Pottery House a quality experience and even their green credentials make the mark. The owners were helpful and friendly without being intrusive. No complaints really.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B in a great location

aka: Pottery House Loch Ness B&B Dores, Scotland
description: Pottery House is a modern, friendly and comfortable B&B overlooking Loch Ness. Our rural location is on the edge of the village of Dores and yet Inverness and many Highland tourist spots are within easy reach. Our rooms are large, our en-suites luxurious and our breakfasts extensive and include freshly baked home made rolls, and preserves. Plus one of the top rated Highland restaurants, The Dores Inn, is just a 5 minute walk away.
